<@U67BXBF99> is this issue already filed somewhere ?
```julia> f(@nospecialize(t)) = f(Type{t})
f (generic function with 1 method)

julia> @code_typed f(Int)
ERROR: StackOverflowError:```

elements.text: is this issue already filed somewhere ?

julia> f(@nospecialize(t)) = f(Type{t})
f (generic function with 1 method)

julia> @code_typed f(Int)
ERROR: StackOverflowError:

text:
the problem also happens for this actually-terminate code:
```julia> tdepth(@nospecialize(t)) = isempty(t.parameters) ? 1 : 1+tdepth(t.parameters[1])
tdepth (generic function with 1 method)

julia> f(@nospecialize(t)) = tdepth(t) == 10 ? t : f(Type{t})
f (generic function with 1 method)

julia> f(Int) # terminates
Type{Type{Type{Type{Type{Type{Type{Type{Type{Int64}}}}}}}}}

julia> @code_typed f(Int) # never```

elements.text: the problem also happens for this actually-terminate code:

julia> f(Int) # terminates
Type{Type{Type{Type{Type{Type{Type{Type{Type{Int64}}}}}}}}}

julia> @code_typed f(Int) # never

text: no, that is almost hilariously easy to trigger
